definition: bellwether
neck/collar/to lead/to receive/classifier for clothes, mats, screens etc
suffix for nouns
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
surname Yang
sheep/goat/CL:頭|头[tou2],隻|只[zhi1]

sentences.english: Comments, industry leader who also makes no secret of their endeavors.
sentences.chinese: 言谈中，行业领头羊们也毫不讳言各自的努力方向。

sentences.english: Nowaday China is the real head of the world.
sentences.chinese: 现今中国己经是真正地世界领头羊了。

sentences.english: Alabama is now college football's number-one-ranked team.
sentences.chinese: 阿拉巴马大学现在成为了大学橄榄球联赛的领头羊。

sentences.english: Paris remains the bellwether of fashion industry.
sentences.chinese: 在服装行业，巴黎仍然保持着领头羊的地位。

sentences.english: The International Federation is spearheading development initiatives in volunteering development.
sentences.chinese: 联合会将作为志愿者发展的领头羊。

sentences.english: Johannesburg is also known as the economic engine of Southern Africa and the trendsetter of South Africa.
sentences.chinese: 约翰内斯堡也被称作是南非的经济的发动机和领头羊。

sentences.english: When he’s done, he goes to China and becomes the top man there.
sentences.chinese: 称霸之后，他又移师中国，十年成为业界领头羊。

sentences.english: Top would be fine, but to be near the top would mean the run-in would present us with an opportunity.
sentences.chinese: 头名当然好，但紧追领头羊意味着我们还有机会。

sentences.english: Iowa is the leader in the use of ethanol-blended gasoline.
sentences.chinese: 爱荷华州是使用乙醇混合型燃油的领头羊。

sentences.english: Nowaday China is the real head of the world.
sentences.chinese: 现今中国已经是真正的世界领头羊了。

sentences.english: In just a decade or two another country will be playing first violin in the orchestra of the chocolate nations - Switzerland.
sentences.chinese: 在未来的岁月中，瑞士将成为巧克力业的领头羊。

sentences.english: Now we have become the leading company in POP SWEET industry.
sentences.chinese: 目前已成为跳跳糖行业的领头羊。

sentences.english: We are the absolute leaders in alcohol consumption.
sentences.chinese: 我们绝对是酒类消费的领头羊。

sentences.english: Japan has been called the lead goose in that V-formation.
sentences.chinese: 日本过去被称作这个腾飞的人字型群体中的领头羊。

sentences.english: The United States primacy on the Top500 list has slipped for a number of reasons.
sentences.chinese: 美国在500强名单上失去领头羊地位的原因有很多。

sentences.english: Nowaday China is the real brain of the world.
sentences.chinese: 现今中国已经是真正的世界领头羊了。

definition: to take the lead in a race/to set the pace
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
top of the list
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
to advance singing loudly (idiom); triumphant progress
table of scores (in exams or sports league)
dark horse/fig. unexpected winner
lit. frontline troops/leader/trailblazer/pacesetter
to try hard to catch up
strong contingent/elite squad
focus/focal point
big boss/leader of a group/dominant (position)
to fall behind/to lag (in technology etc)/backward/to retrogress
to catch up vigorously/to set off in hot pursuit
first rate/top rank/number one
to emerge as a new force to be reckoned with (idiom)
